member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.EmailUid.EmailId
member.summary: used in POP3 commands to indicate which message (only valid in the present session)

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.EmailUid.Uid
member.summary: Uid is always the same for a message, regardless of session

member.name: T:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.EmailUid
member.summary:
Combines Email ID with Email UID for one email The POP3 server assigns to each message a unique Email UID, which will not change for the life time of the message and no other message should use the same.
Exceptions: Throws Pop3Exception if there is a serious communication problem with the POP3 server, otherwise

member.name: T:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.Pop3Exception
member.summary: If anything goes wrong within Pop3MailClient, a Pop3Exception is raised

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.Pop3ConnectionStateEnum.None
member.summary: undefined

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.Pop3ConnectionStateEnum.Disconnected
member.summary: not connected yet to POP3 server

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.Pop3ConnectionStateEnum.Authorization
member.summary: TCP connection has been opened and the POP3 server has sent the greeting. POP3 server expects user name and password

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.Pop3ConnectionStateEnum.Connected
member.summary: client has identified itself successfully with the POP3, server has locked all messages

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.Pop3ConnectionStateEnum.Closed
member.summary: QUIT command was sent, the server has deleted messages marked for deletion and released the resources

member.name: T:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.Pop3ConnectionStateEnum
member.summary: A pop 3 connection goes through the following states:

member.name: T:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.WarningHandler

member.param: string received from POP3 server

member.name: T:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.TraceHandler

member.name: M:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.Pop3MailClient.DeleteEmail(System.Int32)
member.summary: Delete message from server. The POP3 server marks the message as deleted. Any future reference to the message-number associated with the message in a POP3 command generates an error. The POP3 server does not actually delete the message until the POP3 session enters the UPDATE state.

member.name: M:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.Pop3MailClient.GetEmailIdList(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32}@)

member.summary:
Get a list with the unique IDs of all Email available in mailbox.
Explanation: EmailIds for the same email can change between sessions, whereas the unique Email id never changes for an email.

member.summary: get a list with all currently available messages and the UIDs
member.param: EmailId Uid list
member.returns: false: server sent negative response (didn't send list)

member.summary: Sends an 'empty' command to the POP3 server. Server has to respond with +OK

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.Pop3MailClient.isTraceRawEmail
member.summary:
Should the raw content, the US-ASCII code as received, be traced GetRawEmail will switch it on when it starts and off once finished
Inheritors might use it to get the raw email

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.Pop3MailClient.RawEmailSB
member.summary: contains one MIME part of the email in US-ASCII, needs to be translated in .NET string (Unicode) contains the complete email in US-ASCII, needs to be translated in .NET string (Unicode) For speed reasons, reuse StringBuilder

answer from server

member.name: M:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.Pop3MimeClient.ConvertToDateTime(System.String)

member.name: M:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.Pop3MimeClient.ConvertToTransferEncoding(System.String)
member.summary:
converts TransferEncoding as defined in the RFC into a .NET TransferEncoding
.NET doesn't know the type "bit8". It is translated here into "bit7", which requires the same kind of processing (none).

member.summary: probably '1,0'

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.ContentId
member.summary: It may be desirable to allow one body to make reference to another. Accordingly, bodies may be labelled using the "Content-ID" header field.

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.ContentDescription
member.summary: some descriptive information for body

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.ContentDisposition
member.summary:
ContentDisposition contains normally redundant information also stored in the ContentType. Since ContentType is more detailed, it is enough to analyze ContentType
something like: inline inline; filename="image001.gif attachment; filename="image001.jpg"

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.TransferType
member.summary: something like "7bit" / "8bit" / "binary" / "quoted-printable" / "base64"

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.ContentTransferEncoding
member.summary: similar as TransferType, but .NET supports only "7bit" / "quoted-printable" / "base64" here, "bit8" is marked as "bit7" (i.e. no transfer encoding needed), "binary" is illegal in SMTP

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.ContentType
member.summary: The Content-Type field is used to specify the nature of the data in the body of a MIME entity, by giving media type and subtype identifiers, and by providing auxiliary information that may be required for certain media types. Examples: text/plain; text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1 text/plain; charset=us-ascii text/plain; charset=utf-8 text/html; text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1 image/gif; name=image004.gif image/jpeg; name="image005.jpg" message/delivery-status message/rfc822 multipart/alternative; boundary="----=_Part_4088_29304219.1115463798628" multipart/related; boundary="----=_Part_2067_9241611.1139322711488" multipart/mixed; boundary="----=_Part_3431_12384933.1139387792352" multipart/report; report-type=delivery-status; boundary="k04G6HJ9025016.1136391237/carbon.singnet.com.sg"

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.MediaMainType
member.summary: .NET framework combines MediaType (text) with subtype (plain) in one property, but often one or the other is needed alone. MediaMainType in this example would be 'text'.

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.MediaSubType
member.summary: .NET framework combines MediaType (text) with subtype (plain) in one property, but often one or the other is needed alone. MediaSubType in this example would be 'plain'.

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.ContentStream
member.summary: RxMessage can be used for any MIME entity, as a normal message body, an attachement or an alternative view. ContentStream provides the actual content of that MIME entity. It's mainly used internally and later mapped to the corresponding .NET types.

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.Entities
member.summary: A MIME entity can contain several MIME entities. A MIME entity has the same structure like an email.

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.Parent
member.summary: This entity might be part of a parent entity

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.TopParent
member.summary: The top most MIME entity this MIME entity belongs to (grand grand grand .... parent)

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.RawContent
member.summary: The complete entity in raw content. Since this might take up quiet some space, the raw content gets only stored if the Pop3MimeClient.isGetRawEmail is set.

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.UnknowHeaderlines
member.summary: Headerlines not interpretable by Pop3ClientEmail

member.name: M:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.#ctor
member.summary: default constructor

member.name: M:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.SetContentTypeFields(System.String)
member.summary: Set all content type related fields

member.name: M:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.CreateChildEntity
member.summary:
Creates an empty child MIME entity from the parent MIME entity.
An email can consist of several MIME entities. A entity has the same structure like an email, that is header and body. The child inherits few properties from the parent as default value.

member.name: P:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage.MailStructure
member.summary: Convert structure of message into a string

member.name: T:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.RxMailMessage
member.summary:
Stores all MIME decoded information of a received email. One email might consist of several MIME entities, which have a very similar structure to an email. A RxMailMessage can be a top most level email or a MIME entity the emails contains.
According to various RFCs, MIME entities can contain other MIME entities recursively. However, they usually need to be mapped to alternative views and attachments, which are non recursive.
RxMailMessage inherits from System.Net.MailMessage, but provides additional receiving related information

member.name: T:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.UI.Controls.FlashHorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Mimics the Macromedia flash movie "salign" parameter. Should be implemented in conjunction with FlashVerticalAlignment since both enumerations make up the full salign parameter for the flash movie. When used with FlashVerticalAlignment possible values are (RT R RB T B LT L LB). If both values are set to "Center" the parameter is not rendered to the browser.

member.name: F:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.QuotedPrintable.RFC_1521_MAX_CHARS_PER_LINE
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of characters per quoted-printable line as defined in the RFC minus 1 to allow for the = character (soft line break).
member.remarks: (Soft Line Breaks): The Quoted-Printable encoding REQUIRES that encoded lines be no more than 76 characters long. If longer lines are to be encoded with the Quoted-Printable encoding, 'soft' line breaks must be used. An equal sign as the last character on a encoded line indicates such a non-significant ('soft') line break in the encoded text.

member.name: M:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.QuotedPrintable.DecodeFile(System.String)
member.summary: decodes an entire file's contents into plain text that was encoded with quoted-printable.
member.param: The path to the quoted-printable encoded file to decode.
member.exception: A problem occurred while attempting to decode the encoded string.
There is insufficient memory to allocate a buffer for the returned string.
A string is passed in as a null reference.
An I/O error occurs, such as the stream being closed.
The caller does not have the required permission to open the file specified in filepath.
filepath is read-only or a directory.
member.remarks: Decodes a quoted-printable encoded file into a string of unencoded text of any size.

member.name: M:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.QuotedPrintable.Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes a Quoted-Printable string of any size into it's original text.
member.param: The encoded string to decode.
member.exception: A string is passed in as a null reference.
member.remarks: Decodes a quoted-printable encoded string into a string of unencoded text of any size.

member.name: T:ACSGhana.Web.Framework.Mail.Pop3.QuotedPrintable

summary.para: Robust and fast implementation of Quoted Printable Multipart Internet Mail Encoding (MIME) which encodes every character, not just "special characters" for transmission over SMTP.
More information on the quoted-printable encoding can be found here: http://www.freesoft.org/CIE/RFC/1521/6.htm

remarks.para: The QuotedPrintable class encodes and decodes strings and files that either were encoded or need encoded in the Quoted-Printable MIME encoding for Internet mail. The encoding methods of the class use pointers wherever possible to guarantee the fastest possible encoding times for any size file or string. The decoding methods use only the .NET framework classes.

The Quoted-Printable implementation is robust which means it encodes every character to ensure that the information is decoded properly regardless of machine or underlying operating system or protocol implementation. The decode can recognize robust encodings as well as minimal encodings that only encode special characters and any implementation in between. Internally, the class uses a regular expression replace pattern to decode a quoted- printable string or file.
